text.0: as for a chariotrace the skilful speaker chief sage inventor hath with song been started.
text.1: the sisters ten upon the fleecy summit drive on the carhorse to the resting places.
text.2: the drop of soma pressed by wise nahusyas becomes the banquet of the heavenly people.
text.3: indu by hands of mortal men made beauteous immortal with the sheep and cows and waters.
text.4: steer roaring unto steer this pavamana this juice runs to the white milk of the milchcow.
text.5: through thousand fine hairs goes the tuneful singer like sūra by his fair and open pathways.
text.6: break down the strong seats even of the demons cleansing thee indu robd thyself in vigour.
text.7: rend with thy swift bolt coming from above them those who are near and those who yet are distant.
text.8: prepare the forward paths in ancient manner for the new bymn thou giver of all bounties.
text.9: those which are high and hard for foes to conquer may we gain from thee active foodbestower.
text.10: so purifying thee vouchsafe us waters heavens light and cows offipring and many children.
text.11: give us health ample land and lights o soma and grant us long to look upon the sunshine.
